title: Pensions Warm to Stock Funds Modeled to Mirror Private-Equity Returns
sub_head: A Danish pension manager recently invested $100 million in a fund that tracks a stock index designed to emulate private-equity returns
body:
Some pension managers are interested in investment strategies that seek to reproduce the performance of private-equity funds through a portfolio of public securities, as they look for less costly ways to match the returns associated with alternative assets.
Danish pension manager P+, Pensionskassen for Akademikere, recently invested $100 million in an AXS Investments LLC vehicle that tracks the Thomson Reuters Private Equity Buyout Index, which is designed to replicate the performance of private-equity funds.
